Wagner Labor ArchiveElmer Holmes Bobst Library70 Washington Square South10th FloorNew York, NY 10012(212) 998-2630tamiment.wagner@nyu.eduThis finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace 2018-07-25T18:57:44Describing Archives: A Content Standard
Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Commercial Telegraphers Union Notes and Correspondence on Negotiations with Western Union WAG.266
0.25 Linear Feet (1 boxes)
1946-1949
Scope and Contents
Includes notebooks, contracts, correspondence, and other documents concerning the Commercial Telegraphers Union's negotiations with Western Union in the late 1940s.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
The provenance of this collection is unknown. The accession number associated with this collection is 1950.046.
Conditions Governing Use
The Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Archives has no information about copyright ownership for this collection and is not authorized to grant permission to publish or reproduce materials from it. Materials in this collection, which were created in 1946-1949, are expected to enter the public domain in 2070.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Commercial Telegraphers Union Notes and Correspondence on Negotiations with Western Union; WAG 266; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
